thread.title: Jeremy McConnell confirms he IS the father of Stephanie Davis' baby boy Caben-Albi
thread.title_full: Jeremy McConnell confirms he IS the father of Stephanie Davis' baby boy Caben-Albi

author: Dianne Bourne
title: Jeremy McConnell confirms he IS the father of Stephanie Davis' baby boy Caben-Albi
text:
Jeremy McConnell confirms he IS the father of Caben-Albi, the baby son of his ex-partner Stephanie Davis (Photo: Publicity picture) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Irish model Jeremy McConnell has finally acknowledged that he IS the father of actress Stephanie Davis’ baby boy. 
Former Hollyoaks star Stephanie had always maintained that Jeremy was the father of her child, who she named Caben-Albi after he was born in January. 
But her ex-partner, who she met when both took part in Celebrity Big Brother, had insisted on taking a DNA test on daytime ITV show This Morning to prove it, after a rather messy break-up between the couple. 
After taking the test on live TV on Wednesday, it is not known if he has since received the results. 
But Jeremy has today posted on his Twitter and Instagram pages photos and messages that for the first time appear to confirm he HAS accepted he is the father of the child. 
He tweeted an adorable photo of baby Caben-Albi, with the message: “I’ll love this monkey with every bit of me.” 
On Instagram he added a different photo and said: “Happiest man alive, my new focus”. 
Fans will hope that this brings an end to the very public saga between the two stars since they met on Celebrity Big Brother last year. Stephanie Davis and Jeremy McConnell (Photo: Ian West/PA Wire) 
They fell in love on the show, despite Steph having a boyfriend at the time, and they continued dating on the outside world until things turned sour a few months later. 
Steph soon found out she was pregnant but at the time, Jeremy said it wasn’t true. Read More Drake caught on video in Manchester restaurant ahead of his Arena gigs 
He then denied the baby was his when it became obvious she was expecting, and said he wanted a paternity test. 
Jeremy was seen on This Morning earlier this week having a DNA sample taken, but it is unknown if the test was carried out or what the results were. Read More 
However, it seems like Jeremy is now making it clear that he is the father and that little Caben will be part of his life. Baby Caben-Albi (Photo: Stephanie Davis/Instagram) 
It comes after Stephanie Davis deleted any trace of the statement she put out after her ex took the DNA test. 
Following the This Morning segment, during which Jeremy opened up about not being there for Steph throughout her pregnancy, the ex-Hollyoaks star had tweeted a statement about Jez’s treatment of her. 
She said she felt “humiliated” by the way in which Jeremy demanded to know whether he was the father of her newborn baby, Caben-Albi, and said he had ruined her pregnancy. 
“Stephanie has felt humiliated by Jeremy denying his own son and foolishly announcing publicly his request for a DNA test,” the statement read. 
“Jeremy has caused Stephanie massive amounts of stress, pressure and upset throughout her pregnancy, ruining what for most women is one of the most special time[s] of their lives.” Stephanie Davis and her baby boy Caben-Albi George (Photo: OK! magazine) 
It went on: “Jeremy has at no point throughout the pregnancy or birth been in contact directly with Stephanie. Jeremy was categorically not banned from the birth, nor did he ever ask to attend. 
“Jeremy has been given the option at all times to take part in a DNA test, because of past behaviour Stephanie has requested that this is handled via the correct channels and managed by her solicitor. 
The statement also brought up Jeremy’s “audacity” at turning the situation “into a media circus” and accused him of trying to handle it “on his terms only”. 
But Steph has since taken down the statement, plus screengrabs of a previous tweet posted by Jeremy that denied it was his baby. 
She is yet to comment on Jeremy’s public statements about the tot. Read More
